subject: Regarding Nerium and Thevetia species plantations on National Highways
text: IRd <54 WTTHRf gifeazrot (T3v, 9de7 &k RTHNf HATT4, HRG TRAFR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Ama 4a vi-5 Qa 6, #aer-10, ERqT, 75f fecaft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 T/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/ Environment/2023 Policy Circular No- 7.4.10/ 2023 dated O6th April; 2023 {Decision taken on E-Office File No_ NHAI/02/04/27/2016/001 (Comp. No. 168999)} Sub:: Regarding Nerium and Thevetia species plantations on National Highways- reg: Ref.: Circular No.11013/17/2k/GM (Env.)/277 dated 15.01.2016 (Annexure-1) Vide above reference NHAI  issued directions that planting of  Nerium species (common oleander, Kaner) and Thevetia species (yellow oleander, Peela Kaner) be avoided and not planted in highway side plantations /median plantations till further orders. 2  Now after review of this matter on the basis of experience of last 5 to 6 years, the circular is partially modified to the extent that all species prescribed in species matrix of IRC:SP:21-2009 for different   agro-climatic zones of the country including local best performing indigenous species may be planted. 3_ However , representation of any single plant species may not be more than 25% in plantation project so as to maintain the diversity and avoid monoculture: 4 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority: Encl:: As stated above "oe/,4/22 (Sanjay Kumar Patel) General Manager (Coord:) To: AIl Officers of NHAI HQ ROs/ PIUs/ CMUs/ Site Offices to: 1 .
